page.title: 04CHAWTON HOUSE
page.content: In 1224 the King ordered that two oaks from Alice Holt Forest should be delivered to the St. John family towards making a house in their manor. For about three hundred years the house was in the St. John name until the Knight family bought the estate. Today the Knights still own the house but much of the estate was divided up and sold in the 1950's. Major Edward Knight, his wife ,Elizabeth, and son Robert live in part of the house. In another part son Jeremy and his family live. Other parts have been divided into flats and rented out.
